Definition: A booking of a healthcare event among patient(s), practitioner(s), related person(s) and/or device(s) for a specific date/time.

Short: Elements that belong to all information items.
Definition: Elements that belong to all information items.

Short: A human language, spoken or written.
Definition: A human language, spoken or written.

Short: A set of rules under which this content was created
Definition: A set of rules under which this content was created

Short: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.
Definition: A human-readable narrative, potentially including images, that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human.

Short: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.
Definition: A state that relates to the workflow or interpretation of this resource. Certain status values can modify the meaning of the resource, for example, entered-in-error. When a boolean value is used, Status of true indicates the record is active, false means inactive.

Short: Business identifier or external id for this resource.
Definition: Business identifier or external id for this resource.

Short: A broad categorization of the service (ordered, planned, or performed).
Definition: A broad categorization of the service (ordered, planned, or performed).

Short: A service requested or to be performed during this appointment
Definition: A service requested or to be performed during this appointment

Short: The specialty of a practitioner who (should, will, or did) perform a service.
Definition: The specialty of a practitioner who (should, will, or did) perform a service.

Short: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.
Definition: A code describing the item at a greater level of detail.

Short: The justification, as a code.
Definition:
The justification, as a code.
Reason is a string or CodeableConcept in DSTU2 but in later versions only a CodeableConcept, so we are not going to support a string.

Short: The justification, as reference to a condition or observation.
Definition: The justification, as reference to a condition or observation.

Short: Conditions or situations where the procedure is recommended. In the Performed context, the actual indication should be reported.
Definition: Conditions or situations where the procedure is recommended. In the Performed context, the actual indication should be reported.

Short: The priority of the procedure, as a number (1 being the highest priority)
Definition: The priority of the procedure, as a number (1 being the highest priority)

Short: A text note containing additional details, explanation, description, comment, or summarization.
Definition: A text note containing additional details, explanation, description, comment, or summarization.

Short: Additional information to support referral or transfer of care request
Definition: Additional information to support referral or transfer of care request

Short: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.
Definition: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organization.

Short: Participants involved in appointment
Definition: Participants involved in appointment

Short: A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
Definition:
A period of time defined by a start and end time, date, or year.
If the start element is missing, the start of the period is not known. If the end element is missing, it means that the period is ongoing, or the start may be in the past, and the end date in the future, which means that period is expected/planned to end at the specified time. The end value includes any matching date/time. For example, the period 2011-05-23 to 2011-05-27 includes all the times from the start of the 23rd May through to the end of the 27th of May.

Short: When an action should be done. If the action is a series or recurs (e.g. daily blood sugar testing in the morning) then a Timing can be used to describe the periodicity.
Definition: When an action should be done. If the action is a series or recurs (e.g. daily blood sugar testing in the morning) then a Timing can be used to describe the periodicity.

Short: The point in time when the statement was created.
Definition: The point in time when the statement was created.
